page.title: 17West Dean Church
page.content: West Dean church is in the process of being re-roofed,using as many of the old tiles as possible,at a cost of Â£12,00.The tower was re-roofed in 1984,when Â£7,000 was raised by appeals.A "White Elephant Sale held in Charleston Manor in April 1984 raised Â£3,400 and several owners of local gardens held open days.A new priest has been appointed to the churches of Alfriston,West Dean and Litlington with effect from September 1985.At present three communion services are held a month with average attendance of 6-8 people.A flower festival is planned for 1986.The church contains Epstein's bust of Lord Waverley and a bust of Oswald Birley, the painter.
